instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3R3V0_AON: What is PP3V3R3V0_AON? PP3V3R3V0_AON is the first power rail you need to get a USB-C charger to go from 5v to 20v on an A1534 Macbook with an 820-00045 board..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on, but no image.
threads.message: First it showed some colorful Stripes (like a gpu fault) and than had no Image at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on, but no image.
threads.message:
Check if has USB activity.
If yes, try known good screen.
If not, possibly RAM, or CPU issue...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on, but no image.
threads.message: Check for image on external or with know good screen? If nothing externally or you get stripes externally, dead CPU RIP.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on, but no image.
threads.message: External no Image and USB mouse has no light. I noticed that [LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Consolas]<SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> is only 1.7V[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on, but no image.
threads.message: I have reflowed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and now it turns on :). Now it doesnt recognize the internal SSD

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on, but no image.
threads.message: Reflowed <CHIP>U7890</CHIP> and now everyting works perfectly fine :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on, but no image.
threads.message: Wow lol good job that's a weird one
